Research Jigsaw

Make groups of three.

One student will research either natural, social, or design questions and then will be responsible for teaching about what they learned with their group.

  • One student will research natural questions, questions about the environment, and explore where your water comes from and how it gets to your faucet
  • One student will research social questions, questions about people and communities, and explore how people use water in their daily lives.
  • One student will research design questions, questions about the design process, and explore existing solutions to water conservation.

In your group decide who will research each kind of question. Then write down what kind of question you are researching in the text box below.

Research Links

Natural Research: How Do We Get Our Drinking Water in the U.S.? (National Public Radio)

Social Research: How Do We Use Water? (United States Environmental Protection Agency)

Design Research: Start Saving (United States Environmental Protection Agency)

Research Notes (Lesson 4)

What are you researching?

Look at your scoping table: Which questions did this article help you answer? What do you still want to learn?
